intro: Onosma alborosea var. alborosea, commonly known as the white-flowered onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
